instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board with liquid spill near <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, i change <CAPACITOR>C7100</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR>
now the board seems start but no display <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is OK. i haven't noise (dong) when i plug power cord but i have 20V and between 1and 2A.
the display cable is burn, i change it. i'm afraid the display is dead.
normally the board work on an external display? i have nothing on external display.

Rail G3 is OK

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
This board connects CPU directly to J8500.
Very likely dead CPU, because of overvoltage from backlight rail.
No dedicated GPU, so external video missing too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
No it's not backlight rail burn, it's <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> burn, i check all <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX</SIGNAL> it's all at 3,3V
my friend have the same mac, it work on external display.
i don't understand why you say "No dedicated GPU, so external video missing too"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Usually external video still present, when dedicated GPU available.
Very rare to have external in case like your.

<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL>  is next to backlight high voltage output; that's the reason got burnt.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
ok i understand. 
do you think the display is burn too?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Internal LCD should be good; if no broken...
